content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can create a function `add_yearmonth` in Julia to achieve this as follows:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Create a new column with year and month concatenated
    df[!,"ym"] = map(dt -> string(dt.Year), df.dt) * string(10) * map(dt -> string(dt.Month), df.dt)
    
    return df
end
```

This function will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df` by extracting year and month from each DateTime value in the `dt` column, concatenating them together as an integer in format "yyyymm", and appending it to the DataFrame.
